title: US regulators block Telegram from raising funds through cryptocurrency
text:
New York (AFP) – US securities regulators won an emergency court order Friday to block the messaging application Telegram Group from raising funds by selling unregistered cryptocurrency to investors.

The US Securities and Exchange Commission said Telegram sold 2.9 billion digital tokens called “Grams” without registering the tokens as securities and disclosing risks to investors.

The company raised more than $1.7 billion in funds from US and overseas investors.

The SEC in the past year has ramped up its efforts to combat companies raising funds through questionable digital currencies, which it said are ripe for potential fraud.
description: New York (AFP) – US securities regulators won an emergency court order Friday to block the messaging application Telegram Group from raising funds
